Test Description: Testing basic game understanding and rule understanding.
Question: What is the total number of completed cities the landscape can have after placing each of the option tiles (A, B) in the position marked with an `X`? Give your answer as [A = <num of completed cities after placing Tile A>, B = <num of completed cities after placing Tile B>].
Rationale: Before any placement, there is one completed city. After placing Tile A in the position marked with an X (only one way): it will complete another city by connecting to the adjacent city on two sides into one completed city. Therefore, the total number of cities after placing Tile A will be 2. On the other hand, placing Tile B will complete 2 other cities (one from each side), so the total number of cities after placing Tile B will be 3.
